metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    Report an Error / Correction

Request to Use this Document

Contact

CHEMICALS

psilocybin



Support Erowid Center with a $50 Donation

And get a blacklight-inked "Erologo" tee

NAME : Psilocybin CHEMICAL NAME : 3-[2-(Dimethylamino)ethyl]-1H-indol-4-ol dihydrogen phosphate ester ALTERNATE CHEMICAL NAMES : O-phosphoryl-4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine; Indocybin CHEMICAL FORMULA C 12 H 17 N 2 O 4 P MOLECULAR WEIGHT 284.25 MELTING POINT 220-228° C (Crystals from boiling water) MELTING POINT 185-195° C (Crystals from methanol) pH 5.2 (in 50% aq ethanol) LD 50 285 mg/kg i.v.(mice) LD 50 280 mg/kg i.v. (rats) LD 50 12.5 mg/kg i.v.(rabbits) From the Merck Index 12th Edition

3D Psilocybin Molecule

NAME : Psilocin CHEMICAL NAME : 3-[2-(Dimethylamino)ethyl]-1H-indol-4-ol ALTERNATE CHEMICAL NAMES : 4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine; psilocyn CHEMICAL FORMULA C 12 H 16 N 2 O MOLECULAR WEIGHT 204.27 MELTING POINT 173-176° C (plates from methanol) From the Merck Index 12th Edition


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides detailed chemical information on psilocybin and psilocin, including their names, formulas, molecular weights, melting points, and sources, as part of Erowid's comprehensive catalog of psychoactive substances. It is relevant for users seeking specific chemical data on these hallucinogens within the broader context of Erowid’s resources on plants, chemicals, and related substances.

                    Text: 
                    3D Psilocin Molecule


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed chemical information and molecular structure data for psilocin, a primary hallucinogenic compound found in psilocybin mushrooms, highlighting its chemical name, formula, molecular weight, melting point, and structural representations, and situates it within the broader context of related compounds like psilocybin.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    8111. Psilocybin. 3-[2-(Dimethylamino)ethyl]-1H-indol-4-ol; O-phosphoryl-4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine; Indocybin. CHNOP; mol wt 284.25. C 50.71%, H 6.03%, N 9.86%, O 22.51%, P 10.90%. The major of two hallucinogenic compounds in Teonanacatl, the sacred mushroom of Mexico, the other component being psilocin, q.v. from the fruiting bodies of Psilocybe mexicana Heim, Agaricaceae: Hofmann et al., Experientia 14, 107 (1958); Heim et al., Helv. Chim. Acto 42, 1557 (1959); Heim et al., Ger pat. 1,087,321 (1960 to Sandoz). Structure: Hofmann et al., Experientia 14, 397 (1958). Synthesis: Hofmann, Troxler, U.S. pat. 3,075,992 (1963 to Sandoz). Crystal structure: H.P. Weber, T.J. Petcher, J. Chem. Soc., Perkin Trans. II 1974, 942. Converted to psilocin in vivo. Toxicity data: E. Usdin, D.H. Efron, Psychotropic Drugs and Related Compounds (National Institute of Mental Health, Rockville, Md., 2nd ed., 1972) p 138. Reviews: Hofmann, Proc. 1st Int. Congr. Neuro-Pharm., Rome 1958, 446; Cerletti,


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides a detailed chemical profile of psilocybin, including its molecular structure, chemical names, molecular weight, composition percentages, and key research references, situating it within the broader context of the webpage's comprehensive information on psychoactive substances. It highlights psilocybin as one of the primary hallucinogens found in sacred mushrooms, emphasizing its chemical properties, synthesis history, and toxicology data for research and reference purposes.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    Psychotropic Drugs and Related Compounds (National Institute of Mental Health, Rockville, Md., 2nd ed., 1972) p 138. Reviews: Hofmann, Proc. 1st Int. Congr. Neuro-Pharm., Rome 1958, 446; Cerletti, Deut. Med Wochenschr. 84, 2317 (1959); Hofmann, Bull. Narcotics 23, 3 (1971). Crystals from Boiling water, mp 220-228° from boiling methanol, mp 185-195°. uv max (methanol): 220, 267, 290 nm (log E 4.6, 3.8, 3.6). pH 5.2 in 50% aq ethanol. Sol in 20 parts boiling water, 120 parts boiling methanol; difficultly sol. in ethanol. Practically insol in chloroform, benzene. LD50 in mice, rats, rabbits (mg/kg): 285, 280, 12.5 i.v. (Usdin, Efron). Note: This is a controlled substance (hallucinogen) listed in the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations, Title 21 Part 1308.11(1995). THERAP CAT: Psychomimetic 8110. Psilocin. 3-[2-(Diumethylamino)ethyl]-1H-indol-4-ol; 4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine; psilocyn. CHNO; mol wt 204.27. C 70.56%, H 7.89%, N 13.71% O 7.83%. The minor hallucinogenic component of


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed chemical and pharmacological data on psilocybin and psilocin, two hallucinogenic compounds found in magic mushrooms, as documented in a 1972 publication by the National Institute of Mental Health. It includes molecular formulas, structural information, toxicity, solubility, and regulatory status, situating these compounds within the broader context of psychoactive substances covered in the document. The information is relevant for understanding the chemical properties, effects, and legal considerations of these entheogenic drugs.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    8110. Psilocin. 3-[2-(Diumethylamino)ethyl]-1H-indol-4-ol; 4-hydroxy-N,N-dimethyltryptamine; psilocyn. CHNO; mol wt 204.27. C 70.56%, H 7.89%, N 13.71% O 7.83%. The minor hallucinogenic component of Teonanacatl, the sacred mushroom of Mexico. Isolated in trace amounts from the fruiting bodies of Psilocybe mexicana Heim, Agaricaceae: Hofmann et al., Experientia 14, 107 (1948); Heim et al., Helv. Chim. Acta 42, 1557 (1959). Prepn: Heim et al., Ger. pat 1,087,321 (1960 to Sandoz). Synthetic precursor of psilocybin: Hofmann, Troxler, U.S. pat. 3,075,992 (1963 to Sandoz). Psilocin, the 4-hydroxy analog of psilocybin, is formed by metabolic dephosphoylation of psilocybin and is the active species in thh central nervous system: Hoita, Weber, Toxicol Appl. Pharmacol. 4, 730 (1962). Crystal structure: T.J. Petcher, H.P. Weber, 730 (1962). Crystal structure: T.J. Petcher, H.P. Weber, J. Chem Soc. Perkin Trans. II 1974, 946. Review Hofmann, Bull. Narcotics 23, 3 (1971) Plates from methanol, mp


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides detailed chemical information, identification, and references about psilocin, a minor hallucinogenic compound in psychedelic mushrooms, including its molecular properties, natural sources, synthesis, and structural data, situating it within the broader context of the document's discussion on psilocybin and related compounds.

metadata.title: Erowid Psilocybin & Psilocin Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.

content:
Drug: Psilocybin | cid: 10624
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of psilocybin & psilocin.
Erowid name: psilocybin
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    T.J. Petcher, H.P. Weber, 730 (1962). Crystal structure: T.J. Petcher, H.P. Weber, J. Chem Soc. Perkin Trans. II 1974, 946. Review Hofmann, Bull. Narcotics 23, 3 (1971) Plates from methanol, mp 173-176°. Amphoteric substance. Unstable in soln, esp. akaline soln. Very slightly sol in water. uv max: 222, 260, 267, 283, 293nm (log E 4.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.7, 3.6). Note: This is a controlled substance (hallucinogen) listed in the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations, Title 21 Part 1308.11(1995). TiHKAL 18: Psilocybin / Psilocin


                    Context: 
                    This chunk summarizes key chemical properties and research references for psilocin, a hallucinogenic compound found in psychedelic mushrooms, including crystal structure data, solubility issues, UV absorption spectra, and legal classification. It is part of the detailed chemical information section within the broader Erowid page on psilocybin and psilocin, supporting research and identification efforts.
